questions.text: Who was asking about wedding gifts?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	He asked if he had to give a wedding gift. Sam was annoyed with Norm since he still swore there wouldn't ever be a wedding between him and Diane.

questions.text: Who came to the bar and bought everyone a drink?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Fitzgerald

	Duncan Fitzgerald was played by Richard Erdman. He has been acting since 1944 when he appeared in "Janie".

questions.text: Who did Cliff think would be a good match for Duncan?
questions.explanation:
Ma Clavin.

	Esther (Ma) Calvin was played by Frances Sternhagen. Throughout the shows run, she was a frequent guest star. Cliff was very attached to his mother, which often gave the gang at Cheers another reason to pick on Cliff.

questions.correct: He didn't talk very much at home.
options: He used to be a woman.
questions.explanation:
He didn't talk very much at home.

	Cliff never stopped talking at the bar. He was always giving the others useless trivia, most of which wasn't very accurate. But at home, Ma Clavin said he was quiet. That was probably because at home she was always giving him useless trivia facts.

Michigan.

	Duncan was a very rich man which is why Cliff wanted him to marry his mother. Cliff didn't care much about his mother's happiness, but rather, he saw dollar signs in front of his eyes.

questions.text: Did the woman and Duncan get engaged?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	They got engaged after a week of going out. They knew it was fast but they figured at their age why wait.

questions.correct: Duncan was giving away his money.
options: Duncan decided not to marry Cliff's mother.
Duncan didn't like the United States Postal Service
questions.explanation:
Duncan was giving away his money.

	Esther Clavin told Duncan she didn't care about his money so he decided to give most of it to charity. He was happy he met someone that cared about him, not his wealth.

questions.text: What did Sam say Cliff was behaving like?
questions.explanation:
a class A jerk.

	Cliff knew he was being a jerk but he really wanted that money. But he finally came around and realized his mother's happiness was what really mattered.

options: The United States Postal Service Fund
questions.explanation:
Save the Clavin Foundation.

	Cliff figured if Duncan was going to give away his money, he should give it to Cliff. Cliff claimed he always was poor and always would be poor.

questions.text: What bad thing happened in this episode?
options: They decided not to get married.
questions.explanation:
Duncan died.

	Duncan had a heart attack and died during his bachelor party. Esther at first acted like everything was fine, but then at the end she wept.
